actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to impose additional sanctions against countries that repeatedly provide support for international terrorism, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Anti-Terrorism Sanctions Act of 1990 - Requires that certain trade sanctions be imposed upon countries listed as supporting international terrorism. Authorizes the President to waive such sanctions, after written notification to the Congress, if he determines that it would be in the best interests of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to impose additional sanctions against countries that repeatedly provide support for international terrorism, and for other purposes.
